definitions.definition: an arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place
the act of appointing someone to a position or role

phrases.example: I need to make an appointment with the doctor.
She always keeps her appointments on time.

examples.sentence: I have an appointment with my dentist tomorrow at 3 p.m.
examples.translation: 我明天 下午3点和牙医有个预约。

examples.sentence: His appointment as CEO was announced last week.
examples.translation: 他被任命为首席执行官的消息上周公布了。

etymology.historicalDevelopment: 该词源于中世纪英语，通过古法语‘apointer’（意为安排）进入英语，最终追溯到拉丁语‘ad punctum’，意为‘到某个时间点’。最初用于表示时间上的约定，后扩展为职位任命的含义。

learningTips: 通过与‘约会’场景联想，将发音与‘point’联系起来，强化记忆。
区分‘预约’和‘任命’两种含义，结合具体语境反复练习。

examples: I have an appointment with my lawyer.
Her appointment as director was unexpected.

culturalContext.culturalSignificance: 在英语文化中，‘appointment’常与准时和正式性相关联，特别是在职业和医疗场景中，体现了对时间管理的重视。

regionalVariations.variation: 更常用于正式场合，如医疗预约。
regionalVariations.usage: 常与NHS（英国国家医疗服务体系）预约相关。

regionalVariations.variation: 使用范围更广，也常用于非正式场合。
regionalVariations.usage: 如约会朋友或商业会面。

culturalContext.historicalContext: 在历史语境中，‘appointment’常用于描述贵族或官员的正式委任，与权力和地位挂钩。
culturalContext.modernUsage: 在现代社交媒体和影视剧中，常用于描述个人日程安排，带有日常化和普及化的趋势。

visualScene.description: 想象自己在一个医生办公室前台，拿着日历安排预约时间。
visualScene.emotionalConnection: 回忆自己曾经预约医生或面试的紧张感。

mnemonicDevices.content: appointment 发音类似‘a point meant’，意为‘一个指定的点’。
mnemonicDevices.explanation: 通过发音与‘point’（点）的联系，联想到‘指定时间点’的含义。

syntacticPatterns.description: 表示与某人有约会或预约
examples: I have an appointment with my teacher tomorrow.

syntacticPatterns.description: 表示被任命为某个职位
examples: His appointment as chairman was controversial.

commonMistakes.mistake: I have an appointment to my doctor.
commonMistakes.correction: I have an appointment with my doctor.
